data.title: Excellent Food
data.text: We chanced upon this little café by chance and it was a brilliant find.  Food freshly cooked and nothing was too much trouble for the staff.  Even though they closed at 2.30pm we didn't get there until 2.15pm we didn't feel rushed or that the staff were wishing we would leave would go there again every day if we could

data.title: Great food
data.text: We love Molly Brown's. Have been going there for years. Small place, great atmosphere. Friendly staff.

data.title: Time With Daughter and Grands
data.text:
Molly Brown's Country Cafe is my favorite Cafe in the High Desert. I have gone for breakfast and lunch/early dinner. I was there   last Thursday, November 10. The food is very tasty, well prepared, large potions  and beautifully presented. And the service, what can say "It's superb, the waitresses are very attentive and friendly and if you go a few times they will get to know you. Now I have only gone to the one in Victorville, 13778 Hesperia Road and we have been going there for about eight years. It's a family favorite. Their hours are 6:00am - 2:30pm.
Go Enjoy

data.title: the restaurant
data.text: food and coffee are regular, waitress get too confuse for small place, price is fair for what you get.

data.title: Good to dad
data.text: This place is close too our house, so Eric took my dad for breakfast one day to check it out, they kept bragging about it, so I went one day with them.  It is a nice, clean café with great service and very good food.  They are very attentive and friendly with everyone, but they seem to take special care to make sure my dad (87 yrs old) has everything he needs that everything is to his liking.  The country fried steak was wonderful and tender and the eggs cooked perfect!  Eric really likes their open face turkey sandwich with mashed potatoes and gravy, this time he tried the open faced beef sandwich and it too was quite good.  Dad had eggs benedict and it too was tasty, huge amounts of ham and perfect poached eggs, the sauce very nice.  I will go back and have told friends to go by and give them a try, good food and a good value

data.title: Great Food
data.text: I love going to Molly Brown's on Saturday morning for breakfast because everyone is so friendly,  the food is very good and their portions are very generous.  I can't say I have ever had a bad meal at Molly's.

data.title: Not to bad
data.text: Breakfast is great, service was good. Oatmeal was hot and creamy. Cost was reasonable. Will go again

data.title: 12 Kitzhaber Tour
data.text: Stopped here for lunch on a Sunday on our way to San Diego from Vegas. Very busy but when we finally got in (30 minutes), it was totally worth it. Pumpkin bread is phenomenal and the portion sizes are huge. Our waitress, Kim, was very attentive and sweet. There are two other locations just make sure you put the correct address in your GPS. The one on 16575 Smoketree is actually in Hesperia not Victorville.

data.title: Sweet Molly Brown
data.text: On our journey from LV to San Diego we called in at Molly Browns diner for lunch. Molly Browns is a traditional, family diner tucked away in Hisperia near the railroad tracks. We were welcomed by a very polite waitress who took us to our table in the appeared to be a cosy dining area decorated in typical home decor. My wife had the Turkey melt sandwich, I had the Santa Fe skillet. Portions were enormous, tasty and well cooked. We would recommend anyone wanting to have a homestyle breakfast or lunch to call in.

data.title: Not excellent but very Good Breakfast, with cramped seating and long wait.
data.text:
Heard allot of hype about this place.  Probably slightly disappointed that it didn't live up to the hype, but probably not a totally fair assessment.  The wait was long (Sunday am about 1030), the food was definitely better than your run of the mill Denny's or IHOP, but it was so cramped that it was impossible to have a semi private conversation with my breakfast mate.  We might as well have been sitting at the same table.. Lol.

I know that there is at least two other restaurants in this small chain, i haven't been to them but perhaps the atmosphere at those spots were a bit less "cozy".

data.title: I like to go there at least once a week and have breakfast with my night crew from work.
data.text: I go there to have good down home cooked food after a night of work. THere food is great and if your there before 8 am M-F they have good cheap deals.

data.title: Good Breakfast
data.text: Omelette was good did not dig the biscuits and gravy he, but that's the way it goes. Staff was friendly enough.  Go check it out!

data.title: Friendly Atmosphere
data.text: The staff at Molly Brown's are always so friendly! The food is delicious and the portions are huge. I have never been for lunch but I would definitely recommend for breakfast.

data.title: Sunday Morning Breakfast
data.text: We went to Victorville to celebrate a very good friend's Birthday.  We all met at Molly's on Sunday Morning.  Very, very busy and not that big of a restaurant.  We had to wait a little bit buy well worth the wait.  Dahlia was our server and she took care of all our needs plus her other tables as well.  The food was cooked as ordered and the overall restaurant was very clean.  Nice place to dine.

data.title: Yummy
data.text: Although there can be a little wait time. It is well worth it! The food is delicious, and there is plenty of it. A very pleasant breakfast and staff!

data.title: Yummy
data.text: I absolutely love this place omg one of my favorite places to eat. It beats Dennys and Ihop. You can actually share a plate with your loved one. Unless he can a really big plate by himself. My favorite is the omelets. Pancakes are big and fluffy.

data.title: Delicious Breakfast and Lunch
data.text: Molly Brown's is delicious. We went for breakfast and were so happy returned for lunch. On both visits, staff was friendly and food was delicious! Will definitely go back. Servings can be easily split between two adults.

data.title: Molly Browns - Helendale, CA.
data.text:
One of the BEST places for breakfast and lunch.  Meals can easily be split, as my wife usually do (most of the time).
This is worth the effort to locate and have a meal. Nice menu, home made soup and pies.

Very reasonably priced.

data.title: Excellent Service
data.text: Everyone there was awesome. The food was great. Loved it. Injust wished they were maybe open for dinner. Sometimes you crave breakfast at night

data.title: Something for Everyone!
data.text:
My son and husband and I stopped here after church, about 10:30 a.m.
It is a small, casual place and there was a line for a table, so we say at the bar. 
Wide variety of things (many tempting) on the menu. Food portions were very generous and we ate more than we should have. (Next time my husband and I will split a plate!) Service was amazing. Place is bustling. Highly recommend for down home comfort food.
